content:
I've just made a PR to the style guide to allow by tac1; tac2. Any thoughts?
https://github.com/leanprover-community/leanprover-community.github.io/pull/135
I think I still prefer the braces version because it emphasizes the fact that there are no multiple goal.
I prefer the semicolon version because it is easier to type and there is less visual clutter. But I'm not dead set on it.
Let's try out these fancy new Zulip features :)
(I'm not dead set on the braces version either, of course! :-)
I think that both should be allowed. For one line proofs, if they are inspectable at ;, I don't care too much which version is used.

No claim that this is consistent or followed at all, but I read ; as separating a "main" tactic from a secondary one. Like intro; simp or simp; refl, simp is clearly doing all the work. If there are three+ tactics or things are more balanced I'd lean toward {,}.
I only use ; now in situations where there really is more than one goal. I believe this aids reading of code
